page.title: 19St.Margaret's Church
page.content: St.Margaret's Church, Darenth was built in 940. It is one of the oldest churches in England. It has a porch, splayed windows, a font, three arches, two carved stone heads in the wall outside, a nave and a bell tower. There is St.Luke's Room at the side of the church. People call it "The Little Church Over The Hill". St.Margaret's has over a hundred graves. There are faces on the posts to scare away evil spirits. It has a Sunday School for children to learn about God and Jesus. About twenty children go to Sunday School and about seventy people attend Sunday morning services. There is a May Queen service at the beginning of May. Children in Darenth vote for who they want to be May Queen
